content: In the following questions, I will provide you with a graph (given as an array of nodes and an array of edges), a starting point, and a target point. Please return the shortest path from the starting point to the target point in the following format: 1->2->3->4... Please note that your answer should only include the result in this format and should not contain any other words.(Notice that for the same graph, if the start and end points of the problem are swapped, the new shortest path should be the reverse of the original shortest path.)

The shortest path from node 3 to node 13 in the provided graph is:


```arduino
3->2->9->7->13
```
Please note that this is the shortest path and it does not include any intermediate nodes. If you need the reverse path (node 13 to node 3), then you can simply swap the start and destination nodes in the above path.

The shortest path from node 13 to node 3 in the provided graph is:


```arduino
13->7->9->3
```
This is the shortest path that includes node 3 as the final destination. If you need the reverse path (node 3 to node 13), then you can simply swap the start and destination nodes in the above path.
